title: Rihanna is queen of our hearts as she rocks leopard print for book launch
text:
Who gave her permission? (Picture: Getty/AP)

Rihanna has been busy serving looks as she celebrates the launch of her new book.

Music, makeup, publishing – seriously, is there anything this woman can’t do?

The star, who recently revealed why she turned down performing at the Super Bowl, looked absolutely incredible rocking up to the Guggenheim Museum in New York City.

Clearly feeling herself, RiRi gave us her best smoulder as she posed ahead of the event.

The ‘visual autobiography’, which the singer has worked on for five years, could be seen on display and we’re so ready for it.

She’s taking over every industry (Picture: WireImage)

Rihanna recently announced her new project, trolling fans who have been waiting for new music just a little bit.

Taking to Twitter on Monday, the Rude Boy singer shared with us she’s spent the past half-decade working on a book of memories.

Advertisement

‘Over 5 years in the making… happy to finally share this collection of incredible memories,’ she wrote alongside a clip.

‘Thanks to all of the photographers & artists that contributed & to @phaidon for working with me to publish my first piece of art in a new industry!’

Turns out this blessing of a book will feature over 1,000 images of the star, so we have a lot to be thankful for this week.

RiRi’s been working on the book for five years (Picture: Getty Images North America)

The hardcover tome, aptly titled Rihanna, is 504 pages of awesomeness which will, according to Rolling Stone, feature dozens of ‘intimate’ photos of Rihanna’s ‘life as a musician, performer, designer, and entrepreneur’.

With fans waiting patiently for R9, the star has been taking over just about every industry under the sun and we can’t say we’re mad about it tbh.

Werk (Picture: Evan Agostini/Invision/AP)

However, she has been slowly giving us details about the new album, recently revealing it’s reggae-inspired.

‘I like to look at it as a reggae-inspired or reggae-infused album,’ she explained to Vogue. ‘It’s not gonna be typical of what you know as reggae. But you’re going to feel the elements in all of the tracks.’

The 31-year-old went on to say: ‘Reggae always feels right to me. It’s in my blood. It doesn’t matter how far or long removed I am from that culture, or my environment that I grew up in; it never leaves.’

Basically, there’s a whole lot to be excited for in Rihanna world right now.
